result.execSummary:
The defendant Linda J. Linden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Linda J. Linden is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Linda J. Linden was found guilty of Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
DE must submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Linda J. Linden

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
2:31 pm - 15CF32 & 15CF34 - Defendant Linda J. Johnson appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA moves to change caption to Linda J. Linden.  So ordered. DA states agreement. DA certifies victims rights compliance.  DA moves to amend 15CF32 to Misd. A - Receiving stolen property - 943.34(1) and amend Ct. 1 in 15CF34 to Misd A. Theft by Fraud - 943.20(1)(d). Court questions DE regarding right to attorney. DE waives attorney.  Court orders amendment. DE pleads NO CONTEST to amended charges.   Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on 15CF32 and Ct. 1 in 15CF34 and on motion of DA dismisses Ct. 2 in 15CF34. Appeal rights given. Adj. 2:48 pm. 

Court imposes:
15CF32 - Sentence withheld - 1 year probation.
Conditions:
$243 court costs
$200 DNAAS
Apology
50 hours community service
$45 SBDA

15CF34 (Ct. 1) - Sentence withheld - 1 year probation. 
Conditions:
$243 court costs
Apology
$65 SBDA

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

15CF32 & 15CF34 - Defendant Linda J. Johnson appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.   DE waives right to attorney.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled. One bond both cases.
